items.title: Protests in Iranian City Where ‘Everything Is Covered in Brown Dust’
items.abstract: Residents of Ahvaz, a center of oil production, protested for days over dust storms, power failures and government mismanagement.

items.title: A French City Dropped Meat From Kids’ Lunches. The Nation Erupted.
items.abstract: The Green party mayor of Lyon, a gastronomic capital, introduced no-meat menus in schools. Let the anguish begin.

items.title: Is This the Last Generation to Live on New York City’s Wild Fringes?
items.abstract: A major restoration project aims to protect the Jamaica Bay area — and all of New York — by returning salt marshes and sand dunes to their natural states. But will it be too late for the people of Broad Channel?

items.title: The City Plants a Tree, but I Don’t Want It
items.abstract: Can anything be done if the city plants a tree in the sidewalk in front of your house?

items.title: Red Cedar: An Urban Pioneer
items.abstract: The Eastern red cedar, actually a juniper, is a pioneer species, happiest as the first woody plant to root in places like abandoned lots.
